body:
## Highlights
* Consider missing signature equivalent to non-generic one by @raboof in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/696
* Cross-compile for Native by @armanbilge in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/700
* Document `mimaExcludeAnnotations` by @SethTisue in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/711
* Removing method while making trait package-private is NOK by @armanbilge in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/699
* Honour outer's exclude annotations by @dwijnand in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/713

## New Contributors
* @armanbilge made their first contribution in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/700

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/1.1.0...1.1.1

## What's Changed
* Unpickle package-private from TASTy by @dwijnand in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/683
* Allow checking in an on-the-fly mode while still benefiting from other sbt settings by @nafg in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/680
* Version updates: Scala 2.13.8 and 3.1.2, sbt 1.6.2

## New Contributors
* @nafg made their first contribution in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/680

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/1.0.1...1.1.0

## What's Changed
* Fix accidental double readEnd by @dwijnand in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/655
* Enabled cross build with Scala 3.x for core by @xuwei-k in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/657
* Enable -Xsource:3 and reduce noise by @som-snytt in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/663

## New Contributors
* @som-snytt made their first contribution in https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/663

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/1.0.0...v1.0.1

## Significant Changes

Introduces `mimaExcludeAnnotations: SettingKey[Seq[String]]]` which define the fully-qualified class names of annotations that exclude parts of the API from the problem reporting.

This was implemented to ease the maintenance of the scala3-library, where there are `@experimental` classes and methods that haven't committed to their binary API yet.

In this release, the new feature's support for Scala 2 remains partial. Annotated classes are handled; annotated methods aren't, yet.

Fixes [#160](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/160) with [#647](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/647).

## Bugfixes

* Fix unpickling method-local class parents. #639 / #642

# Bugfixes

* Fix an AssertionError that threw in the recently added unpickling, to do with method mismatching between the bytecode and the scala signature (pickle). https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/630 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/634 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/635
* Fix a NoSuchElementException that also threw in the recently added unpickling, to do with how nested class names mentioned the pickle are mangled to find them in the bytecode.  https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/631 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/636

Commit log: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.9.1...0.9.2

## Changes

- Fix resolving Scala 3 artifacts [#613][]/[#624][] by [@julienrf][]

[#613]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/613
[#624]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/624
[@julienrf]: https://github.com/julienrf

## The Entire Commit Log

<https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.9.0...0.9.1>

## Significant Changes

- Ignore package private classes [#53](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/53) / [#583](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/583) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)
- Initial Scala 3 support (i.e. make the existing test suite pass when using the Scala 3 compiler) [#587](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/587) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)

## Less Significant Changes

- source change necessitated by upcoming 2.12.13 change [#580](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/580) by [@SethTisue](https://github.com/SethTisue)
- Get latest sbt-extras [#605](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/605) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)

## The Entire Commit Log

<https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.8.1...0.9.0>

## Enhancements

- Resolve ambiguity introduced by JDK 14 [#556](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/556) by [@SethTisue](https://github.com/SethTisue)
- Fix error message [#555](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/555) by [@xuwei-k](https://github.com/xuwei-k)
- Extract andClose [#553](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/553) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)
- Close classpath directory after listing [#552](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/552) by [@raboof](https://github.com/raboof)
- Use sbt (1.0's!) dependencyResolution [#551](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/551) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)
- Make Logging public again [#549](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/549) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)
- Bunch of little readme tweaks [#546](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/546) by [@SethTisue](https://github.com/SethTisue)

## Updates

- Update coursier to 2.0.3 [#565](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/565) by [@scala-steward](https://github.com/scala-steward)
- Update munit to 0.7.14 [#563](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/563) by [@scala-steward](https://github.com/scala-steward)
- Update sbt to 1.4.0 [#561](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/561) by [@scala-steward](https://github.com/scala-steward)

## New features

- Catch binary-incompatible method overriding in traits [#541](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/541) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)

## Enhancements

- Use CoursierDependencyResolution rather than IvyDependencyResolution [#508](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/508) by [@alexarchambault](https://github.com/alexarchambault)
- Make DependencyResolution configurable [#509](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/509) by [@alexarchambault](https://github.com/alexarchambault)
- Don't normalize names [#510](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/510) by [@alexarchambault](https://github.com/alexarchambault)
- Parse signatures to avoid false positives [#505](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/505) by [@raboof](https://github.com/raboof)
- Fast-fail on unsupported Scala versions [#486](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/486) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)
- Cut dependency on scala-compiler and scala-reflect [#495](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/495) by [@dwijnand](https://github.com/dwijnand)
- Replace sys.exit(-1) with sys.error(msg) [#490](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/490) by [@htmldoug](https://github.com/htmldoug)

For full details see the [milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestones/0.8.0) and/or the [changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.7.0...0.8.0).

## Features

* Checking generic signatures is now opt-in.  #471

Most MiMa checks (`DirectMissingMethod`, `IncompatibleResultType`, `IncompatibleMethType`, etc) are against the method `descriptor`, which is the "raw" type signature, without any information about generic parameters.
The `IncompatibleSignature` check compares the `Signature`, which includes the full signature including generic parameters. This can catch real incompatibilities, but also sometimes triggers for a change in generics that
would not in fact cause problems at run time. Notably, it will warn when updating your project to scala 2.12.9+ or 2.13.1+, see #423 ("Signature checks fail using value classes & upgrading to 2.12.9+ or 2.13.1+") for details.

This check is now disabled by default. You can opt-in to it by setting:

```scala
ThisBuild / mimaReportSignatureProblems := true
```

## Improvements

* Improve problem reporting ([#475][]), specifically, it now:
	* logs at the appropriate log level (warn/error, if there are problems/fatal problems)
	* includes the version of the artifact compared against
	* includes the number of filtered out problems

## Bugfixes

* Fix a regression in how version filtered are... filtered.  [#468][]

## Other changes

* Drop Bintray, switch releasing the plugin to Maven Central.  [#469][]

For full details see the [milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestones/0.7.0) and/or the [changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.6.4...0.7.0).

[#468]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/468
[#469]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/469
[#475]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/475

## Bugfixes

* Fix a regression in problem identification, since 0.6.1 a case of `IncompatibleResultTypeProblem`s were being reported as `DirectMissingMethodProblem`. [#459][] / [#460][] by @raboof (thank you!)

For full details see the [milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestones/0.6.4) and/or the [changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.6.3...0.6.4).

[#459]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/459
[#460]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/460

## Bugfixes

* Fix a false negative when removing all method implementations from a trait (with results in the loss of the trait's "initialisation" method, which is binary incompatible).  [#426][] / [#448][] (kindly reported by @travisbrown)

## Other improvements

* Clarify the `IncompatibleSignatureProblem` message & link to the docs in the README.  [#435][] by @raboof
* Test infra: run the functional tests, to ensure they're correct.  Motivated by the false negative in [#426][].  [#427][] / [#444][] 
* Restore sbt 1.2.8 support.  [#453][]
* Lots and lots of cleanup and refactoring.  See the [entire changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.6.1...0.6.3) details.

For full details see the [milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestones/0.6.3) and/or the [changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.6.1...0.6.3).

[#426]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/426
[#427]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/427
[#435]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/435
[#444]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/444
[#448]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/448
[#453]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/453
[#444]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/444
(Failed release.  Details in the release tracking issue: [#454](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/454))

## Breaking change

This release of MiMa uses sbt 1.3, which isn't forward-compatible with previous versions of sbt 1 (e.g. sbt 1.2.8).  That means your build must on sbt 1.3 in order for it to use MiMa 0.6.1+.  The step-wise approach would be to upgrade the build to sbt 1.3 first and then upgrade it to use MiMa 0.6.1.

## Hotfix

This release of MiMa is built against the scala compiler 2.12.10, which allows it to be used within sbt 1.3.1+ (fixes [#389](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/389)).

For full details see the [milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestones/0.6.1) and/or the [changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.6.0...0.6.1).

* Correctly display static methods https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/371
* Ignore when the first constructor parameter is dropped from the signature https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/378
* Removed overloads are missing, not incompatible https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/362
* Verify all overloads for result types and signatures https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/345

## Migration notes

The last 2 highlighted changes fix the fact that previously some `DirectMissingMethodProblem`s were incorrectly reported as `IncompatibleResultTypeProblem`/`IncompatibleMethTypeProblem` and vice-versa. If you have added filters for such cases to your project, when upgrading to mima 0.6.0 you might have to update those to filter out `DirectMissingMethodProblem` instead (example: https://github.com/akka/akka-http/pull/2656/files).

# Fixing the impact of 0.4.0's breaking change

The [0.4.0](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/releases/tag/0.4.0) release of MiMa included a breaking change that sought to help users discover when they were running `mimaReportBinaryIssues` but hadn't configured `mimaPreviousArtifacts`.

Unfortunately, that had a larger impact than expected, quickly brought to light thanks to the [PRs sent by the ScalaSteward](https://github.com/pulls?q=author%3Ascala-steward+is%3Apr+%22sbt-mima-plugin+to+0.4.0%22+sort%3Aupdated-desc) (see the [ScalaSteward annoucement](https://www.scala-lang.org/blog/2019/07/10/announcing-scala-steward.html) blog post!).

With the release of MiMa 0.5.0 we've been able to solve the initial issue by being able to differentiate when `mimaPreviousArtifacts` was unset by the user and when it was purposely set to the empty set (for instance, if their library cross-builds to Scala 2.13 but hasn't yet been released for Scala 2.13).

Additionally the README has been fully refreshed and now gives better guidance, in particular see the [Setting different `mimaPreviousArtifacts`][docs1] and [Make `mimaReportBinaryIssues` not fail][docs2] sections, the latter of which details how use 0.4.0's `mimaFailOnNoPrevious` setting to handle breakages.

[docs1]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima#setting-different-mimapreviousartifacts
[docs2]: https://github.com/lightbend/mima#make-mimareportbinaryissues-not-fail

#328/#334/#338

## Additional improvements

* Fix resolving previous artifacts that defined their Scala version suffix. #327/#329

For full details see the [milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestones/0.5.0) and/or the [changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.4.0...0.5.0).

# Breaking changes

## When mimaPreviousArtifacts is not set, default mimaReportBinaryIssues to fail

As of v0.4.0 `mimaReportBinaryIssues` will, by default, fail if `mimaPreviousArtifacts` is empty, to avoid users thinking they're checking binary-compatibility when they aren't.

You may need to apply one of the following to mitigate this change:

* set `mimaPreviousArtifacts` for all the projects that should be checking their binary compatibility
* set `mimaFailOnNoPrevious := false` on specific projects that want to opt-out (alternatively `disablePlugins(MimaPlugin)`)
* set `mimaFailOnNoPrevious in ThisBuild := false`, which disables it build-wide, effectively reverting back to the previous behaviour

https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/263 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/289

## Dropped sbt 0.13 support

As of v0.4.0 MiMa no longer supports sbt 0.13 and is only available for sbt 1.x.  We encourage you to update to sbt 1.x, and until that time use keep using MiMa v0.3.0.

https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/269 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/272

## Dropped Scala 2.10 support

Support for Scala 2.10 has also been dropping, meaning you should continue to use MiMa v0.3.0 to verify binary compatibility of a Scala 2.10 project.

https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/248 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/272

# Improvements

## Checking generic signatures

This release introduces a new problem type, the `IncompatibleSignatureProblem`. This problem is reported when a method's erased signature has remained the same, but its full type signature has changed. Such a change is not always binary incompatible, but typically worthwhile to manually investigate and explicitly confirm. You can exclude all such problems with a `ProblemFilters.exclude[IncompatibleSignatureProblem]("*")`.

This change also fixes a problem where `IncompatibleResultTypeProblem` instances were missed. This means that this upgrade may require adding filters for old, but previously undetected, incompatibilities.

https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/40 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/299

## Additional improvements

* https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/162 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/254 Don't fail if an effectively final method becomes final
* https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/201 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/295 Don't fail when migrating from Java varargs to `@varargs`
* https://github.com/lightbend/mima/issues/168 / https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/323 Handle `mimaPreviousArtifacts` with dots in their name
* https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/239 Allow multiple filter files per version to be loaded from a directory
* https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/238 Improve the error message when filter files fail to be processed
* https://github.com/lightbend/mima/pull/305 Subsume the mima-reporter project (and jar) into mima-core

For full details see the [0.4.0 milestone](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/milestone/18?closed=1) and/or the [0.3.0...0.4.0 changelog](https://github.com/lightbend/mima/compare/0.3.0...0.4.0).

[#206]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/issues/206
[#207]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/207
[#208]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/208
[#209]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/209
[#210]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/210
[#212]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/issues/212
[#213]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/213
[#214]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/214
[#216]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/216
[#219]: https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/pull/219

[@2m]: https://github.com/2m
[@SethTisue]: https://github.com/SethTisue
[@dwijnand]: https://github.com/dwijnand
[@raboof]: https://github.com/raboof

Bumped to 0.3.0 because of the CLI removal.

* Fixes a runtime exception on Java 9's new tags, by ignoring them. [#206][]/[#207][] by [@dwijnand][]
* Adds support for versions with less segments (e.g v1.2). [#212][]/[#214][] by [@2m][]
* Removes MiMa's CLI. [#208][]/[#209][] by [@dwijnand][] and [@2m][]
* Removes use of sbt-assembly and sbt-buildinfo. [#216][] by [@dwijnand][]
* Update copyright and docs maintenance. [#210][]/[#213][] by [@SethTisue][]
* Bump from Scala 2.12.4 to 2.12.6. [#219][] by [@dwijnand][]

https://github.com/lightbend/migration-manager/compare/0.2.0...0.3.0

## Bugfixes

This release contains a single bugfix (#196) thanks to @nick-nachos where a filter to exclude `InheritedNewAbstractMethodProblem` was needed on a parent class instead of the child class.

After updating to this MiMa version, there might be new BC issues reported which were not reported before. In that case the suggested filter should be added and previous filter for the same method in parent class should be removed. This change in functionality is the reason for a new minor version.

# Enhancements

+ Switches to using [sbt-compat](https://github.com/dwijnand/sbt-compat) to avoid runtime errors like https://github.com/typesafehub/sbt-whitesource/issues/20

# Bugfixes

+ Refixes (sadly) a backwards binary compatibility issue using sbt-mima-plugin 0.1.15/0.1.16 (for sbt 1) with Scala 2.12.3. #191/#190/#194 by @dwijnand

# Bugfixes

+ Fixes a backwards binary compatibility issue using sbt-mima-plugin 0.1.15 (for sbt 1) with Scala 2.12.3. #191/#190 by @dwijnand
+ Fixes a forwards binary compatibility issue using sbt-mima-plugin 0.1.15 (for sbt 0.13) with sbt < 0.13.16. #183/#190 by @dwijnand

# Features

+ Adds Scala 2.12 and sbt 1 support. #169/#175/#180/#181 by @lrytz /@szeiger /@dwijnand
+ Adds wildcard support to exclude problem filter. #171/#172 by @2m
+ Adds filter file support. #170/#174 by @2m

# Enhancements

+ Restores the ability to build an assembly jar of MiMa. (See also https://github.com/xuwei-k/mima). #166/#167 by @fanf

# Bugfixes

+ Fixes an issue where problems where leaking when both backwards and forward compatibility. #176 by @2m

---

For full details see the [0.1.14...0.1.15 changelog](https://github.com/typesafehub/migration-manager/compare/0.1.14...0.1.15) and/or the [0.1.15 milestone](https://github.com/typesafehub/migration-manager/milestone/12?closed=1).

name: Migration Manager 0.1.14
body:
This release contains two bugfixes:
- migration manager now analyses classes with symbolic names in objects (#158)
- migration manager sbt plugin now releases memory sooner allowing for shorter run times when analysing projects with many subprojects (#163)

All tickets fixed for this release can be found on the [milestone page](https://github.com/typesafehub/migration-manager/milestone/11?closed=1).

name: 0.1.13 - ready for Scala 2.12.1
body:
Some improvements and integration tests - in preparation for Scala 2.12.1.
- Add integration tests (5 days ago) <Stefan Zeiger>
- Avoid false positives for classes defined in methods (6 days ago) <Jason Zaugg>

Thanks Stefan, Jason!

name: Migration Manager 0.1.12
body:
- fix regression in command-line (non-sbt) runs where no checks were performed unless `--direction` was specified (regressed in 0.1.9) (#137)
- detect changes to inner objects (#127)
- detect added methods in value classes (#135)
- detect changes to default parameters (#136)
- support Java-defined static members (#142)
- deprecated keys removed from sbt plugin (#134)

contributors to this release: Stefan Zeiger, Jason Zaugg, Mirco Dotta, Seth Tisue

thanks also to P. Oscar Boykin, Hanns Holger Rutz, Dale Wijnand, and Pap Lőrinc for finding bugs

fixes:
- "Bad constant pool" errors when running concurrently (#115)

The major new feature in this release is support for Java 8 default interface methods, which are used in Scala 2.12's new trait encoding.

The complete list of changes since 0.1.9 can be found [here](https://github.com/typesafehub/migration-manager/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Amerged+milestone%3A0.1.10).

Migration Manager now has an ability to check for forward binary incompatibilities as well (#87).

Due to outdated dependencies, maintenance burden and low usage frequency, GUI front end for MiMa has been removed (#80).

Migration Manager SBT Plugin has been converted to an AutoPlugin, thanks to @dwijnand (#103), which means that appropriate settings are now automatically added to all projects in the build. Additionally, while following [SBT Plugin Key naming conventions](http://www.scala-sbt.org/0.13/docs/Plugins-Best-Practices.html#Avoid+namespace+clashes), keys now start with `mima` and old key names have been deprecated.

Added versioned issue filter support, which allows specifying a minimal artifact version for issue filters (#65).

fixes:
- don't report added toString override as "added method" (#76)
- evolving a final class to be an object is not a binary compatible evolution (#75)
- Missing types `{java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object}` bug (#74)
- Ignore bridge methods (#36)
- Ignore added/removed and changed anonymous lambdas for Scala 2.12.x (#92)
